title: Get the dynamic quota on active ad groups

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

top_fields.name: data
top_fields.description: Returned data. Note : If the advertiser ( advertiser_id ) is subject to fixed active ad group quota, you will receive total_adgroup_quota = 5000 and used_adgroup_quota = 0 in the response. If the advertiser ( advertiser_id ) is being punished, there will be no active ad groups allowed to create. The returned total_adgroup_quota and used_adgroup_quota will be set to 0. You can check whether an advertiser account is being punished through the status returned by /advertiser/info/ .

fields.name: total_adgroup_quota
fields.description: The maximum number of active ad groups that the advertiser ( advertiser_id ) can have.

fields.name: used_adgroup_quota
fields.description: The number of active ad groups that the advertiser ( advertiser_id ) currently has. Note : When the advertiser has used up all your dynamic active ad group quota ( total_adgroup_quota = used_adgroup_quota ), the advertiser can still create additional ad groups, but the additional ad groups will be automatically deactivated after several seconds. Also, the advertiser cannot use /adgroup/status/update/ to reactivate the deactivated ad groups.
